intro: Sersalisia liukiuensis, commonly known as the Liuqu Island sersalisia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with yellow petals and a distinctive, fragrant scent. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
